intro: Scurrula dodoneifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf scurrula, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses in warmer climates.
